title: [Gameplay] Warwick ult is stunning!
body:
Warwick's ult is now applying a stun instead of a suppress. This is a bad thing. The bad part is that if someone silences warwick and stops his ult you will still be stunned and he can still auto you (happened to me). It seems that for some reason someone changed his ult to a stun and this needs to be fixed.

How to reproduce:
1-Play warwick
2-Press r

Your ult stunned them and didn't suppress them. Successfully reproduced bug.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=XShadowAlkX,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QrpEdy0P,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-12-16T00:13:39.361+0000)
>
> How to reproduce:
> 1-Play warwick
> 2-Press r
> 
> Your ult stunned them and didn't suppress them. Successfully reproduced bug.

It still suppresses them; they even have the "Supressed" debuff.

> [{quoted}](name=Sona Ping,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QrpEdy0P,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-12-16T12:21:48.922+0000)
>
> It still suppresses them; they even have the "Supressed" debuff.

  But the only difference between a suppression is that during the duration both the caster and target are suppressed until the end of the channel duration or the caster cancels it/ gets cc'ed. If Warwick cancels his ult or gets cc'ed the target stays suppressed. Therefore, Warwick's ult is technically a stun now.

> [{quoted}](name=XShadowAlkX,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QrpEdy0P,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-12-16T20:42:04.214+0000)
>
> But the only difference between a suppression is that during the duration both the caster and target are suppressed until the end of the channel duration or the caster cancels it/ gets cc'ed. If Warwick cancels his ult or gets cc'ed the target stays suppressed. Therefore, Warwick's ult is technically a stun now.

No... a suppress does not mean that both caster and target are suppressed. Skarner ult and Tahm W are direct counter examples to your claim. Therefore, you are incorrect and WW's ult is still a suppress.

> [{quoted}](name=M0b1us,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QrpEdy0P,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-12-16T20:55:56.160+0000)
>
> No... a suppress does not mean that both caster and target are suppressed. Skarner ult and Tahm W are direct counter examples to your claim. Therefore, you are incorrect and WW's ult is still a suppress.

... Can Skarner or Tahm Kench use abilities while they are suppressing someone? No? Then guess who's right :).

> [{quoted}](name=XShadowAlkX,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QrpEdy0P,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-12-19T14:24:53.980+0000)
>
> ... Can Skarner or Tahm Kench use abilities while they are suppressing someone? No? Then guess who's right :).

Skarner can Q while he is ulting... Again you are proven wrong. Go do some research.

> [{quoted}](name=M0b1us,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QrpEdy0P,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2015-12-19T14:36:36.021+0000)
>
> Skarner can Q while he is ulting... Again you are proven wrong. Go do some research.

I'm sorry, I shouldn't have tried to argue with a little kid who always thinks they're right. Skarner q is an exception but none others can do this. The fact is a suppress causes the caster to channel, and if the caster stops channeling then the target is no longer suppressed. ALL channels are canceled by silences but for some reason warwick's ult suppress doesn't stop if hes silenced. Therefore his ult IS BUGGED as the suppress SHOULD stop, but it doesn't. Please tell me that skarner's ult doesn't stop suppressing after skarner dies. Oh wait it does stop suppressing after skarner dies? If you think that warwick's ult isnt bugged then you are awfully wrong.

> [{quoted}](name=XShadowAlkX,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QrpEdy0P,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-12-21T20:25:30.595+0000)
>
> I'm sorry, I shouldn't have tried to argue with a little kid who always thinks they're right. Skarner q is an exception but none others can do this. The fact is a suppress causes the caster to channel, and if the caster stops channeling then the target is no longer suppressed. ALL channels are canceled by silences but for some reason warwick's ult suppress doesn't stop if hes silenced. Therefore his ult IS BUGGED as the suppress SHOULD stop, but it doesn't. Please tell me that skarner's ult doesn't stop suppressing after skarner dies. Oh wait it does stop suppressing after skarner dies? If you think that warwick's ult isnt bugged then you are awfully wrong.

Took you that long to form some form of a response? Here, since you don't seem capable of forming a coherent argument, allow me to post a link for you that will explain the difference between a supress and a stun.

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Suppression#Suppression

Now stop wasting our time because you are too lazy to do a little research.
doesn't seem like you can cleanse the ult when I tried testing it

> [{quoted}](name=Raith alghul,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=QrpEdy0P,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-12-16T01:06:09.179+0000)
>
> doesn't seem like you can cleanse the ult when I tried testing it

  OK I removed the cleanse part but still the Warwick ult cc isn't being removed if you silence him during his ult. You stay cc'ed even if Warwick dies during his ult.

I think WW has some frames during his ult where it can't be cancelled, so that might be why the CC is not ending when he is silenced, I made a video a while back showing how you can't buffer an Ahri charm to cancel his ult. Might be a similar occurrence, even though the charm hits him and you can see the animation the ult still goes off.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1eBB_0_X1Tc
